intro: Vernonia kerrii, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Vernonia kerrii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
